title: Three arrested over murder of athlete stabbed to death on Tube
text:
Tashan Daniel was knifed to death on the Tube (Picture: British Transport Police)

Two men have been arrested over the murder of an aspiring athlete who died onboard a London Tube carriage.

Tashan Daniel, 20, was stabbed to death at Hillingdon Underground Station on September 24, after being attacked while on his way to an Arsenal match.

A man, 21, from Uxbridge, and a man, 19, from Wembley, have been arrested by British Transport Police over the young man’s murder.

A woman, 18, from West Drayton, has also been arrested on suspicion of assisting an offender.

All three suspects are currently in police custody for questioning.

Police previously said Mr Daniel was with a friend when two other men provoked a fight, during which the 20-year-old was knifed in front of horrified passengers.

Mr Daniel, who hoped to become an international 200m sprinter, died in the Tube carriage after a person tried to perform CPR to save him, said witnesses.

Hundreds of people payed their respects at a vigil held for Tashan outside Hillingdon station (Picture: PA)

Paramedics and police officers tried to save him as the station was evacuated but despite best efforts, nothing could be done to prevent his death.

Detective Chief Inspector Sam Blackburn said: ‘We have been working around the clock to trace those responsible for Tashan’s death and this is a positive step in the ongoing investigation.

‘I’d like to thank Tashan’s family for their patience and strength and once again extend our deepest condolences to them. They are continuing to be supported by specially trained family liaison officers.

‘I know the local community and many people across the country have been truly shocked by this senseless and unprovoked killing, and we will continue to work tirelessly to make sure those responsible face justice.’
